result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jerade T. Walker

records.addlTxt: 10:46 AM Defendant Jerade T. Walker appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brian Thomas Stevens appeared by phone for Jerade T. Walker.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Stevens gives status updates. Court questions DA Kelz on proceeding with a Bail Hearing for new charges. DA Kelz is provided with the probable cause and will proceed with a bail bond hearing. Adjourned on theses matters.
Jury trial on January 11, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Final pre-trial on December 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status hearing on September 20, 2022 at 10:45 am.

10:07 AM Defendant Jerade T. Walker in court.  Attorney Brian Thomas Stevens appeared by phone for Jerade T. Walker.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin. DA Kelz states in case 22CF22 no motions have been filed nor are there any Miranda Goodchild Issues. Parties agree. Attorney Stevens states in matter 20CF104 they are ready to set the matter for trial. Comments by parties.
Motion hearing on July 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to counts 1 & 2

11:12 AM DA Karl Kelz calls cases 20CF104 & 22CF22 and states appearances. Defendant Jerade T. Walker in court.  Attorney Brian Thomas Stevens appeared by phone for Jerade T. Walker.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin. DA Kelz gives status of case. Atty Stevens states his client will be waiving preliminary hearing and can proceed with colloquy. Preliminary Hearing waived in 22CF22.  Waiver accepted by the Court. Court finds probable cause exists that a crime was committed and binds DE over for trial. Information filed, acknowledged by parties and reading waived. Atty Stevens enters NOT GUILTY plea on behalf of the DE on each count in each case.
Preliminary hearing on June 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:24 AM Defendant Jerade T. Walker appeared in court. Karl J. Kelz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states he has not recieved a copy of the complaint. Court reads the charges and the maximum penalties. DA Kelz provides the defendant with a copy of the criminal complaint. Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.   Notice of right to attorney given to DE. Bond already set and is to continue.   Preliminary hearing requested, time limits waived.   Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.
States demand for discovery and notice of intent to use DNA
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
Defendant may not have contact with the individual(s): S.A.K.
*No Contact includes: Going to or remaining in any place the individual resides, is employed at, attends school at, or any public location the individual is temporarily located. Contact through means of telephone. Electronic devices, Social media, email, regular mail, or a 3rd party individual is prohibited. The only exception to this order is contact through your attorney or law enforcement in appropriate circumstances. 
Defendant shall not go upon the premises of 256 South Argyle Ave in Phillips, WI

9:30 AM DA calls case and states appearances and possible charges. Defedant appeared via video from Price County Jail. Karl J. Kelz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE next court date is 03/01/2022 at 10 am.  Jail gives DE a notice of right to attorney.  Court questions parties as to bond.  DA states bond recommendation.
